page.title: 19Personal Recollections
page.content: Interviews with two local people have indicated many ways in which life has changed dramatically in Kirton in recent years.Mr.Timson,the village Pharmacist,notices a particular increase in Kirton's elderly population.Two local Old Peoples' Homes,improvements in health care and people retiring to Kirton,are all contributory factors.Previously,most people living in Kirton also worked in Agriculture; now a larger proportion are mobile'white-collar'workers. Closure of the local railway has greatly increased freight and goods traffic on our roads.Bus services have decreased,but so has the popularity of South Lincs'most popular mode of transport-the bike!Greater mobility has resulted in the use of Kirton far more as a'dormitory'area;in fact one third of our pupils'bus-in'each day.
